intro: Guarea macrocalyx, commonly known as the large-flowered guarea, is a tropical tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other hardwoods. The plant is characterized by its large, showy white or yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically alternate and have a heart-shaped or ovate form. The tree produces small, round fruits that contain a single seed, contributing to its ecological role in forest ecosystems.
